Literature.Title: Segment-Based Peptide Design Reveals the Importance of N-Terminal High Cationicity for Antimicrobial Activity Against Gram-Negative Pathogens
Literature.Author: Mechesso AF, Zhang W, Su Y, Xie J, Wang G

Sequence Information.Target Organism: Staphylococcus aureus USA 300 LAC(MIC=8µM),Staphylococcus aureus USA 300 LAC(MIC=>32µM),Staphylococcus aureus USA 300 LAC(MIC=4µM),Staphylococcus aureus USA 300 LAC(MIC=32µM),Staphylococcus epidermidis 1457(MIC=16µM),Pseudomonas aeruginosa E411-17(MIC=16µM),Pseudomonas aeruginosa E411-17(MIC=32µM),Pseudomonas aeruginosa E411-17(MIC=4µM),Pseudomonas aeruginosa E411-17(MIC=>32µM),Escherichia coli E423-17(MIC=8µM),Acinetobacter baumannii B28-16(MIC=>32µM),Human hepatocellular carcinoma HepG2(30-40% Cytotoxicity=100µM),Human lung carcinoma A549(30-40% Cytotoxicity=100µM)
